network

Class ResponseLoginPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.LoginPacket
      • network.ResponseLoginPacket

  • public class ResponseLoginPacket
extends LoginPacket
    Connection / change login response packet. (It is created to respond to a change login request only to deny a login change. When the login change is accepted, no packet if sent over the network.)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static boolean DENIED
      Passed as the constructor first argument to deny a connection or a login change.
      protected static boolean GRANTED
      Passed as the constructor first argument to grant a connection.
      private java.lang.String respondingUserLogin
      The responding user login.
      private java.lang.String respondingUserMacAddress
      The responding user MAC address.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected ResponseLoginPacket(boolean isLoginGranted)
      Constructor to create response packets that deny the request.
      protected ResponseLoginPacket(boolean isLoginGranted, java.lang.String respondingUserLogin, java.lang.String respondingUserMacAddress)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected java.lang.String getDataToSend()
      Serialization method converting this packet to a string to be sent over the network.
      protected java.lang.String getRespondingUserLogin()
      Get the responding user login.
      protected java.lang.String getRespondingUserMacAddress()
      Get the responding user MAC address.
      protected boolean isLoginGranted()
      Tell if the request is granted.

      • Methods inherited from class network.LoginPacket

        getFlag, getSourceAddress, receivePacket, sendPacket

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DENIED

        protected static final boolean DENIED
        Passed as the constructor first argument to deny a connection or a login change.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRANTED

        protected static final boolean GRANTED
        Passed as the constructor first argument to grant a connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • respondingUserLogin

        private java.lang.String respondingUserLogin
        The responding user login. When it is null, it means the request was denied.

      • respondingUserMacAddress

        private java.lang.String respondingUserMacAddress
        The responding user MAC address. When it is null, it means the request was denied.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResponseLoginPacket

        protected ResponseLoginPacket(boolean isLoginGranted)
        Constructor to create response packets that deny the request.
        Parameters:
        isLoginGranted - tell if the request is granted, must be set to false for this constructor

      • ResponseLoginPacket

        protected ResponseLoginPacket(boolean isLoginGranted,
                              java.lang.String respondingUserLogin,
                              java.lang.String respondingUserMacAddress)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        isLoginGranted - tell if the request is granted
        respondingUserLogin - the responding user login
        respondingUserMacAddress - the responding user MAC address

    • Method Detail

      • isLoginGranted

        protected boolean isLoginGranted()
        Tell if the request is granted.
        Returns:
        true if the request is granted, false if it is denied

      • getRespondingUserLogin

        protected java.lang.String getRespondingUserLogin()
        Get the responding user login.

        the responding user login

        Returns:
        the resonding user MAC address

      • getDataToSend

        protected java.lang.String getDataToSend()
        Serialization method converting this packet to a string to be sent over the network. It implements the abstract method from the mother class.
        Specified by:
        getDataToSend in class LoginPacket
        Returns:
        the serialized packet
